body_html:
Ah.. Looks like we are hitting the Windows long path issue.
Basically, Windows doesn't support file path longer than 260 characters. Unfortunately, AFAIK, there's no workaround for cl.exe.

This error is because tensorflow-pull-requests-windows-bazel is long enough to make the file path exceed that limitation.

We'll have to work around this by setting export TMPDIR=c:/temp, so compare to C:\\tools\\msys64\\var\\tmp we can save some characters...
body_text:
Ah.. Looks like we are hitting the Windows long path issue.
Basically, Windows doesn't support file path longer than 260 characters. Unfortunately, AFAIK, there's no workaround for cl.exe.
This error is because tensorflow-pull-requests-windows-bazel is long enough to make the file path exceed that limitation.
We'll have to work around this by setting export TMPDIR=c:/temp, so compare to C:\\tools\\msys64\\var\\tmp we can save some characters...
body:
Ah.. Looks like we are hitting the [Windows long path issue](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1880321/why-does-the-260-character-path-length-limit-exist-in-windows).
Basically, Windows doesn't support file path longer than 260 characters. Unfortunately, AFAIK, there's no workaround for cl.exe. 

This error is because `tensorflow-pull-requests-windows-bazel` is long enough to make the file path exceed that limitation.

We'll have to work around this by setting `export TMPDIR=c:/temp`, so compare to `C:\\tools\\msys64\\var\\tmp` we can save some characters...
